intro: Zanthoxylum pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often aromatic and have a slightly prickly texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to red, berry-like fruits in the fall. Zanthoxylum pittieri is part of the Rutaceae family, which includes other citrus-related plants. It is often used in traditional medicine and landscaping due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
